Articles.Content: I'm really excited for how noob friendly this game looks! Can't wait to spend all my life savings for it! (Def worth it)
I am most excited to try out the new colonization system, once that is released. Aside from that, I am excited to try out the new parts and crash things into the new Kerbal Space Centre.
I am excited for the new orbital VAB and to explore all the old and new planets!

I have come out of hiding to express how excited I am about building with the new parts that have been and will be introduced! Quadruple NTRs will be a huge boon for large interplanetary vessels' part counts.

I'm excited to see what neat new things we can explore and find!

And offworld construction, that's gonna be bomb

Im exited for Multiplayer and coming along for the ride during Early Access. Yes, It may be a bumpy ride but thats what Early Access is about :> and I hope when the issues are ironed out and Multiplayer comes out I can finally play the game with friends than just talk about the game.
My birthday is coming up in just a few days, so hopefully I can get an early present! I have enjoyed KSP for several years, and I'm ready for some multiplayer!
I'm excited to have new challenges, new missions, and get the hell away from the Kerbolar system
I am exited for Harder, Better, Faster and  Stronger KSP
I'm excited to build interstellar starships and set up colonies on various planets like the ones you see on Star Trek.

I was only going to mention the most excellent looking new graphics in the initial release, which will make it easier on the eyes as I scrape the rust off and get back into space exploration; however, I'm MOST excited about multiplayer.
I'm excited to be able to play KSP 2 multiplayer with friends without having to rely on unstable mods or port fowarding.

While I am excited for the procedural parts, obviously, and a more informative HUD, the most important thing to me is, that KSP 2 tries to put KSP onto a more modern and more stable foundation to derive a version from it, that can in the end develop into a feature set, that was simply not possible on the previous version's code base.

Good luck for EA launch day to the whole team and I still hope there will be a linux version coming up soon

Exited for many things but what really impressed me so far is sound effects in the game. I know nobody will focus on these sort of thing but the sound is the one that sets the mood for the game.


PS: I never win these sort of thing but want to give shoutout to the guy recording the rocket sounds.
I really can't wait for Interstellar

Like so any others,I'm excited about colonies. I've spent  lot of my KSP 1 time playing with various life support mods to give some purpose to bases; glad to have something in the core game in KSP2. Oh, and hoping that implies physics that won't require mods and hacks to keep bases from self-destructing on scene change.

I am excited for interstellar travel and all the challenges it will offer. I'm also looking forward to a new look and feel and the promise of better, more consistent resource utilization for unloaded crafts.
I am really looking forward to multiplayer.
Colonies are the the thing I'm waiting for
So eager to test KSP 2 and see the development advancement !
I'm exited for building huge interstellar torchships and colonising other star systems!

I am exited to see how much the lessons learned from creating KSP v1 (framework, floating points of origins and Krakens, etc) will be playing out in KSP2.  Will new techniques use multi-core CPU resources to a great extend?  Will huge rockets be not stuttering in reality?  Will mods be able to access multi-core capabilities and/or graphics card computing power?  There are so many possibilities that can help make KSP2 shine well beyond it's punch weight ... and mod creators have proven they are game-changers.  Literally as well as figuratively.

So the most exiting part is the anticipation of what other people will be creating ... especially in terms of mods that then allow other people to create even more ... mods and vessels and stations and stories and settling new star systems ...

Im really exited for the ability for enhanced building mechanics such as orbital construction, Colony building, off kerbin VABs. I think these will really expand on whats possible for the player. I also cant wait to try out the fuel production plants for metallic hydrogen
I can't wait to see what new mods will be created by @linuxgurugamer and other modders of the community!

I’m excited for building rockets in ksp2 and launching them from the beautiful new site.

Edited February 23, 2023 by NovaSuper
